section.title: Introduction
section.p: DML is a general-purpose XML schema, particularly well suited to books, articles and annotations in other XML sources.
DML is normatively available as a RELAX NG schema with additional Schematron assertions to cover all missing cases.

DML is a simple set of elements and attributes which define the basic semantics for a generic document. It is designed keeping in mind that all specialization may be defined through a scoped XML schema. For example, to mark up code it may be used the Programming Markup Language.
The metadata model use a set of metadata attributes which are originally defined in RDFa Syntax from W3C.
This specification has a style and nomenclature conventions to simplify the reading process.

section.title: Namespace
section.p: The DML namespace has the URI http://purl.oclc.org/NET/dml/1.0/. It is usually associated with the dml prefix.
